body_html:
Also do you have an example of adding a namespace that involves c++ op kernels. Basically I had no problem when I registered my op in tensorflow/core/ops/array_ops.cc but now that I have it in a new file tensorflow/core/ops/manip_ops.cc it doesn't seem to get registered. Running the unit tests gives me

Op type not registered 'Roll' in binary running on Okar.local. Make sure the Op and Kernel are registered in the binary running in this process. while building NodeDef 'myop'

I've been trying to find all the BUILD files that I need to change but a reference would help.

body:
Also do you have an example of adding a namespace that involves c++ op kernels. Basically I had no problem when I registered my op in `tensorflow/core/ops/array_ops.cc` but now that I have it in a new file `tensorflow/core/ops/manip_ops.cc` it doesn't seem to get registered. Running the unit tests gives me
```
Op type not registered 'Roll' in binary running on Okar.local. Make sure the Op and Kernel are registered in the binary running in this process. while building NodeDef 'myop'
```
I've been trying to find all the BUILD files that I need to change but a reference would help.
